medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, specifically in the lower left quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports an abrupt onset of lower abdominal pain 1.5 days ago, initially described as intermittent and lasting seconds. The pain worsened last night and was characterized as sharp and aching at its worst. Symptoms were relieved by Tylenol as well as bowel movement and urination. The patient also noted a low grade fever of 99.0Â°F.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diabetes mellitus, end-stage renal disease secondary to MPGN, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, peripheral neuropathy, and prior renal transplantation.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had cancer removed from skin and hyperlipidemia; father had coronary artery disease and underwent CABG; half siblings are healthy.
